page.title: 08JACKAMOORS WATER CENTRE
page.content: Jackamoors occupies a 3 acre site and has a large fish section and Butterfly Centre.Sunday is the busiest day and educational visits on weekdays are welcomed.11 full-time and 9 part-time staff are employed.There are 600 butterflies, most coming from Malaysia The commonest is the Zebra and the largest the Owl.Amateur entomologist and wholesalers in this country sell to the Centre-buying back excess stock In winter a large heater controls the temperature and in summer, sunlight through glass and netting is suf- ficient.The fish section is stocked from wholesalers in this country or from Singapore & Israel.The commonest fish is the Guppy and the smallest a baby Molly.Their rarest is the large French Angel.All marine plants are supplied from outside.The fish are fed twice a day on prepared or live food.
